item.title: Covid travel rules: Portugal removed from UK green list as seven others join red list
item.description: The country will join the amber list from Tuesday, as seven others are moved to the red list.

item.title: Covid-19: More than half of UK adults have had second jab
item.description: The prime minister welcomes the "amazing achievement" and urges the public to "finish the job".

item.title: Covid: Indian variant 'now dominant' in the UK
item.description: Confirmed cases of the Indian variant have risen to 12,431 in the UK, according to new data from Public Health England

item.title: Louth deaths: Daniel Boulton charged with murder
item.description: Daniel Boulton, 29, is accused of killing Bethany Vincent and her nine-year-old son in Louth.

item.title: Benjamin Netanyahu calls to block Israel's newly formed coalition
item.description: Israel's longest-serving prime minister could be removed from power if an opposition coalition holds.

item.title: Kesgrave shooting trial: Schoolboy 'blasted by shotgun from 1.5m away'
item.description: The double-barrelled gun was seized from a car driven by the 16-year-old defendant, a court hears.

item.title: Labour demands further probe into Boris Johnson's flat revamp
item.description: The party wants the standards watchdog for MPs to look at whether Boris Johnson failed to register a donation.

item.title: Covid: Groups of 30 to be able to meet outdoors in Wales
item.description: A third home will be able to join an extended household but there will be no change to indoor rules.

item.title: Major design flaws in Army's new armoured vehicles, report shows
item.description: The Army has ordered 589 Ajax vehicles, but a leaked report details numerous problems with them.

item.title: Diana interview: BBC trying to make amends, says Bashir whistleblower
item.description: Matt Wiessler was sidelined after he raised concerns about how the BBC's Diana interview was secured.

item.title: Frankie Morris: Police searching for missing teen find body
item.description: The body has not been identified but the 18-year-old's family have been informed, police say.

item.title: Coronavirus: First cruise ship arrives in Venice since pandemic began
item.description: The MSC Orchestra is due pick up passengers for a Mediterranean voyage - but protests are planned.

item.title: Trent Alexander-Arnold: England right-back ruled out of Euro 2020
item.description: Trent Alexander-Arnold is out of Euro 2020 after a scan reveals the injury sustained against Austria is a thigh tear.

item.title: Portugal travel list: 'Let us go on holiday and live our lives'
item.description: UK travellers react with dismay and resignation as quarantine-free travel to Portugal is halted.

item.title: Mysterious-looking fog hides Chinese island
item.description: Aerial footage shows Beihuangcheng Island enveloped in advection fog, making buildings almost invisible.

item.title: Utah girls aged 4 and 9 drive car to 'swim in the ocean'
item.description: The girls drove their parents' car on major roads and crashed into a lorry, but were not hurt.

item.title: Your stories: Out-of-hours work emails
item.description: What do our readers think of receiving work emails outside of office hours?

item.title: Princess Diana's wedding dress goes on display
item.description: The dress, seen by millions on TV in 1981, is being exhibited at her former Kensington Palace home.

item.title: China's new 'tang ping' trend aims to highlight pressures of work culture
item.description: A new trend aims to highlight the pressure on younger people to find jobs and work longer shifts.

item.title: Line of Duty's Vicky McClure and fiance Jonny Owen to sponsor Merthyr Town
item.description: Line of Duty star Vicky McClure and her filmmaker fiance Jonny Owen are to sponsor Merthyr Town.

item.title: Bridget Riley: 'I held a mirror up to human nature and reported faithfully.'
item.description: In an exclusive interview, artist Bridget Riley discusses her career, inspiration and mistakes.

item.title: China elephants: Herd on mammoth 500km trek reaches Kunming
item.description: A herd of 15 elephants bangs on doors and hoovers up food as experts ponder its destination.

item.title: 'I was so scared of house intruders I went into labour'
item.description: A woman tells of the terror she felt when thieves broke into her Edinburgh home in the middle of the night.

item.title: Pride month: The LGBT history you probably didn't learn in school
item.description: Experts say a focus on minority groups in education would give us a better knowledge of our society.

item.title: Covid: The Australian millennials desperate for vaccines
item.description: Locked out of a troubled vaccination scheme, young people are increasingly desperate to get jabbed.

item.title: Why Canada is mourning the deaths of 215 children
item.description: The discovery 215 Indigenous children's remains shocked many. Here's what we know so far.

item.title: England fight back after Conway's 200 for New Zealand
item.description: England make strides towards a first-Test fightback on an entertaining second day against New Zealand at Lord's.

item.title: England v New Zealand: England fight back after Devon Conway's 200 for New Zealand
item.description: Watch highlights as England fight back on day two of the first Test against New Zealand at Lord's, following Devon Conway's double century.

item.title: Federer brushes off umpire row to join Djokovic in French Open third round
item.description: Swiss eighth seed Roger Federer regains his composure during a heated battle with Marin Cilic to reach the French Open third round.

item.title: Hearn ends Sky boxing deal and moves to DAZN in 'seismic' deal
item.description: Eddie Hearn will no longer stage boxing events on Sky Sports after signing a five-year deal with streaming service DAZN.

item.title: Liverpool preparing to open contract talks with goalkeeper Alisson
item.description: Liverpool intend to open contract talks with goalkeeper Alisson Becker when he returns to the club after the summer.

item.title: ‘He’s an absolute genius’ - the inside story of Cristiano Ronaldo at Manchester United
item.description: Former Manchester United power development coach Mick Clegg talks through his experiences of working closely with Cristiano Ronaldo between 2003-2009.

item.title: England v New Zealand: Devon Conway completes brilliant double century with a six
item.description: New Zealand opener Devon Conway completes a double century with a six on a brilliant Test debut against England at Lord's.

item.title: Covid-19: Could a third wave change 21 June plans in England?
item.description: Rising coronavirus cases have called the planned 21 June relaxing of rules in England into question.

item.title: Do social distance rules apply after both vaccine jabs?
item.description: Guidance on hugging close friends and family has being relaxed in England and Scotland.

item.title: Travel guide to Spain, Portugal, France and more holiday hotspots
item.description: What you need to know about travelling abroad to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: What are the rules for travelling to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: Foreign holidays are now possible, but travellers must follow strict rules on their return.

item.title: Coronavirus: When can we stop wearing face masks or face coverings?
item.description: Rules are relaxing, but masks are still needed in some settings - here's where and why.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: The vaccine rollout is now reaching younger adults. What do they need to know about getting jabbed?

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: Scotland's Covid-19 rules are changing at the weekend - but for many, the lifting of lockdown has been "paused".

item.title: Tokyo Olympic Games: When are they and will they go ahead despite Covid?
item.description: The Tokyo Summer Olympics are due to start in July, despite a surge in Covid cases in Japan.

item.title: Covid: How is Europe lifting lockdown restrictions?
item.description: A third Covid wave hit much of Europe hard but now gradually lockdowns are being eased.

item.title: Lockdown rules: What are the restrictions in your area?
item.description: Use our search tool to find out about coronavirus rules and restrictions where you live.

item.title: Covid: Should I be working from home or going back to the office?
item.description: As lockdown restrictions ease gradually across the UK, what are the rules about returning to work?

item.title: Covid vaccine update: Those that work - and the others on the way
item.description: Covid vaccination campaigns are under way in the UK and across the world.

item.title: Lockdown muscle loss: Five ways to get back in shape
item.description: Lockdown inactivity may have left people with weaker muscles - there are simple solutions.

item.title: Coronavirus: What's the risk of Covid on public transport?
item.description: As UK coronavirus restrictions are relaxed, public transport could become much busier.

item.title: How are eviction rules for renters and landlords changing?
item.description: The eviction ban is ending, but what does that mean?

item.title: The Motherload: How pandemic anger almost destroyed a mums' support group
item.description: Abusive messages from angry mums during lockdown almost caused the founder of The Motherload to close it down.

item.title: The children selling explicit videos on OnlyFans
item.description: British subscription site OnlyFans is failing to prevent underage users from selling and appearing in explicit videos, a BBC investigation has found.

item.title: How Ben Crump became America's go-to police brutality lawyer
item.description: When families lose a loved one in a police shooting, more often than not Ben Crump gets a call. Why is he the go-to man?

item.title: Samantha Azzopardi: Australia's notorious con artist sentenced for child theft
item.description: Authorities are baffled by the "bizarre crime" of a serial con artist who has travelled the world.

item.title: After a 32-year battle for justice, what is Hillsborough's legacy?
item.description: As the collapse of the last criminal trial marks the end of a long legal road, Judith Moritz asks what the legacy of Britain’s worst sports disaster is.
